description: The license for the PacketShaper S-series has expired.

event.Summary: The license for the PacketShaper S-series has expired

description: The PacketShaper S-series has lost contact with the
primary BCAAA server. The psAlarmBCAAAPrimaryStatus provides
additonal information about the failure.

Summary.eval: ($v1 == 0) ? 'BCAAA primary server state is unknown' : (($v1 == 1) ? 'BCAAA primary server is ok' : (($v1 == 2) ? 'Unable to login to the BCAAA primary server' : (($v1 == 3) ? 'No primary BCAAA server is configured' : 'BCAAA client service is disabled')))

description: Status of the primary BCAAA server. A status of fail(2) means that PacketShaper
cannot log in to the primary BCAAA server. unconfig(3) means that no primary
BCAAA server is configured. off(4) means that the BCAAA Client service is disabled.
variables.name: BLUECOAT-PACKETSHAPER-S-SERIES-MIB::psAlarmBCAAAPrimaryStatus

description: The PacketShaper S-series has lost contact with the
secondary BCAAA server. The psAlarmBCAAASecondaryStatus
provides additional information about the failure.

Summary.eval: ($v1 == 0) ? 'BCAAA secondary server state is unknown' : (($v1 == 1) ? 'BCAAA secondary server is ok' : (($v1 == 2) ? 'Unable to login to the BCAAA secondary server' : (($v1 == 3) ? 'No secondary BCAAA server is configured' : 'BCAAA client service is disabled')))

description: Status of the secondary BCAAA server. A status of fail(2) means that PacketShaper
cannot log in to the secondary BCAAA server. unconfig(3) means that no secondary
BCAAA server is configured. off(4) means that the BCAAA Client service is disabled.
variables.name: BLUECOAT-PACKETSHAPER-S-SERIES-MIB::psAlarmBCAAASecondaryStatus

description: A psAlarmPowerSystemOne trap signifies that the first power
supply of the device has failed.
A psAlarmPowerSystemTwo trap signifies that
the second power supply of the device has failed.
A psAlarmFan trap signifies that one of the system fans
of the device has failed. The psAlarmFanModuleID specifies
which fan has failed.
The system fan module number.
variables.name: BLUECOAT-PACKETSHAPER-S-SERIES-MIB::psAlarmFanModuleID

description: A psAlarmVoltageSensor trap signifies that a voltage sensor
has detected a voltage outside its allowed range.
The psAlarmVoltageSensorID identifies the sensor

event.Summary: Voltage on sensor $v1 exceeded the allowed range

description: The voltage sensor number.
ps5VMain(8) = 5.5V power supply
ps5VStby(9) = 5.5v standby power supply
ps12V1(10) = 12V power supply one
ps12V2(11) = 12V power supply two
ps1p1V(18) = 1.1V power supply
psCpu(19) = CPU core voltage ,
ps3p3V1(34) = 3.3V power supply one
ps3p3V2(35) = 3.3V power supply two
variables.name: BLUECOAT-PACKETSHAPER-S-SERIES-MIB::psAlarmVoltageSensorID

description: A psAlarmTemperatureSensor trap signifies that a temperature sensor
has detected a temperature outside its allowed range.
The psAlarmTemperatureSensorID identifies the sensor

event.Summary: Temperature on sensor $v1 exceeded the allowed range

description: The temperature sensor number.
for the PS12K the IPMI sensor numbers are used.
mbTemp(1) = Motherboard
psuInTemp1(6) = Power Supply 1 inlet
psuInTemp2(7) = Power Supply 2 inlet
ramA1Temp(51) = RAM DIMM A1
ramA2Temp(52) = RAM DIMM A2
ramB1Temp(54) = RAM DIMM B1
ramB2Temp(55) = RAM DIMM B2
ramC1Temp(57) = RAM DIMM C1
ramC2Temp(58) = RAM DIMM C2
ramD1Temp(60) = RAM DIMM D1
ramD2Temp(61) = RAM DIMM D2
mbTempC(62) = Center Motherboard
mbTempR(63) = Right Motherboard
psuCore1(82) = Power Supply 1 core
psuCore2(83) = Power Supply 2 core
cpuTemp(99) = CPU
variables.name: BLUECOAT-PACKETSHAPER-S-SERIES-MIB::psAlarmTemperatureSensorID

description: A psAlarmMeasurementEngine trap signifies that the Measurement
Engine has changed to a state of less readiness, or failed on
startup.
The current status of the Measurement Engine. The values
enumerated above correspond to those shown in the command
line 'me show' command.
(1) error on startup
(2) not started
(3) disabled
(4) suspended
(5) stopping
(6) backing up data
(7) restoring data
(8) starting
(9) syncing data
(10) running
variables.name: BLUECOAT-PACKETSHAPER-S-SERIES-MIB::psAlarmMeasurementEngineStatus

description: A psAlarmUserEvent trap signifies that a user event, which has
been registered by the user, has occurred. The associated variables
give more information on the event.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD BLUECOAT-PACKETSHAPER-S-SERIES-MIB::psAlarmUserEvent BLUECOAT-PACKETSHAPER-S-SERIES-MIB::userEventTrapName s EXAMPLE BLUECOAT-PACKETSHAPER-S-SERIES-MIB::userEventTrapExpression s EXAMPLE BLUECOAT-PACKETSHAPER-S-SERIES-MIB::userEventTrapVariable s EXAMPLE BLUECOAT-PACKETSHAPER-S-SERIES-MIB::userEventTrapElementType i 1 BLUECOAT-PACKETSHAPER-S-SERIES-MIB::userEventTrapRegid i 9999 BLUECOAT-PACKETSHAPER-S-SERIES-MIB::userEventTrapDate s EXAMPLEE BLUECOAT-PACKETSHAPER-S-SERIES-MIB::userEventTrapValue i 9999 BLUECOAT-PACKETSHAPER-S-SERIES-MIB::userEventTrapTarget s EXAMPLE BLUECOAT-PACKETSHAPER-S-SERIES-MIB::userEventTrapThreshold i 9999 BLUECOAT-PACKETSHAPER-S-SERIES-MIB::userEventTrapRearm i 9999 BLUECOAT-PACKETSHAPER-S-SERIES-MIB::userEventTrapDayCount i 9999 BLUECOAT-PACKETSHAPER-S-SERIES-MIB::userEventTrapDayLimit i 9999

description: The name of the user event which has occurred.
variables.name: BLUECOAT-PACKETSHAPER-S-SERIES-MIB::userEventTrapName

description: The expression defining this user event.
variables.name: BLUECOAT-PACKETSHAPER-S-SERIES-MIB::userEventTrapExpression

description: The name of the Measurement Engine variable which is
tested in this user event.
variables.name: BLUECOAT-PACKETSHAPER-S-SERIES-MIB::userEventTrapVariable

description: The type of element which is tested in this user event.
variables.name: BLUECOAT-PACKETSHAPER-S-SERIES-MIB::userEventTrapElementType

description: The registration of this user event.
variables.name: BLUECOAT-PACKETSHAPER-S-SERIES-MIB::userEventTrapRegid

description: The time the event occurred.
variables.name: BLUECOAT-PACKETSHAPER-S-SERIES-MIB::userEventTrapDate

description: The value of userEventTrapVariable which triggered the event.
variables.name: BLUECOAT-PACKETSHAPER-S-SERIES-MIB::userEventTrapValue

description: The name of the link, class, or partition
as given in userEventTrapElementType, which is
the target of this event regiatration.
variables.name: BLUECOAT-PACKETSHAPER-S-SERIES-MIB::userEventTrapTarget

description: The threshold value which triggers this event.
See the value of userEventTrapExpression
for the signedness with respect to the threshold (<, >, etc.)
variables.name: BLUECOAT-PACKETSHAPER-S-SERIES-MIB::userEventTrapThreshold

description: The rearm value which must be hit after an occurrence
of this event in order to rearm it.
See the value of userEventTrapExpression
for the signedness with respect to the threshold (<, >, etc.)
variables.name: BLUECOAT-PACKETSHAPER-S-SERIES-MIB::userEventTrapRearm

description: The number of times this event has occurred on this
day (as counted from midnight to midnight, local time).
If this value is greater than or equal to userEventTrapDayLimit
and that value is non-zero, then no more instances of this
event will be reported until the next day.
variables.name: BLUECOAT-PACKETSHAPER-S-SERIES-MIB::userEventTrapDayCount

description: The maximum number of times this event is allowed to occur per
day (as counted from midnight to midnight, local time)
as configured by the user. A value of zero denotes no limit.
variables.name: BLUECOAT-PACKETSHAPER-S-SERIES-MIB::userEventTrapDayLimit

description: A psAlarmAgentEvent trap signifies that an agent event, which has
been triggered by the user, has occurred. The associated variables
give more information on the event.

Summary.eval: ($v4 eq '') ? 'A $v3 agent event has been triggered by a user' : '$v4'

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD BLUECOAT-PACKETSHAPER-S-SERIES-MIB::psAlarmAgentEvent BLUECOAT-PACKETSHAPER-S-SERIES-MIB::agentEventTrapName s EXAMPLE BLUECOAT-PACKETSHAPER-S-SERIES-MIB::agentEventTrapDate s EXAMPLEE BLUECOAT-PACKETSHAPER-S-SERIES-MIB::agentEventTrapType i 1 BLUECOAT-PACKETSHAPER-S-SERIES-MIB::agentEventTrapDescription s EXAMPLE

description: The name of the agent instance which has fired the event.
variables.name: BLUECOAT-PACKETSHAPER-S-SERIES-MIB::agentEventTrapName

description: The time the event occurred.
variables.name: BLUECOAT-PACKETSHAPER-S-SERIES-MIB::agentEventTrapDate

description: The type of event that occurred, 5 = GREEN, 1 = RED, 2 = YELLOW, 3 = BLUE, 4 = GREY.
variables.name: BLUECOAT-PACKETSHAPER-S-SERIES-MIB::agentEventTrapType

description: A description of the event that has occurred.
variables.name: BLUECOAT-PACKETSHAPER-S-SERIES-MIB::agentEventTrapDescription

description: A psFeatureHighAvDeviceDown trap signifies that an interface
or router we are tracking has gone down. If it is an interface that
went down, the bindings will show the corresponding router and the
name of the interface which went down. The name will be specified
as 'unknown' if we could not resolve the interface name. But if it
is the router that went down, the interface name will not be specified.
The operational status of the interface of the router
we are polling.
(1) UP
(2) DOWN.
variables.name: BLUECOAT-PACKETSHAPER-S-SERIES-MIB::psFeatureHighAvDeviceDownStatus

description: The name of a router that has gone down
or the name of the router whose one of the
interfaces has gone down.
variables.name: BLUECOAT-PACKETSHAPER-S-SERIES-MIB::psFeatureHighAvDeviceDownRouter

description: The name of the interface that has gone down. The name
will be specified as 'unknown' in the cases where we
could not resolve the interface name. The interface
name will have a value of NULL or zero-length value
if the router goes down.
variables.name: BLUECOAT-PACKETSHAPER-S-SERIES-MIB::psFeatureHighAvDeviceDownInterface
